intro: Rosularia tauricola, commonly known as the Tauric Rosularia, is a perennial flowering plant native to the Caucasus region. It belongs to the family Crassulaceae and is characterized by its compact, rosette-forming growth habit. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of pink and white during the summer months. Rosularia tauricola is adapted to rocky and arid environments, showcasing succulent leaves that store water. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and low maintenance requirements.
